metadata.title: CVE-2023-38575 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Non-transparent sharing of return predictor targets between contexts insome Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20240514.0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20240514.0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
